word:
South Lancaster, Thursday, October 16, 1890 

     Rode out with Brother Robinson to Clinton. It was a beautiful day and we enjoyed the ride much. . . . Visited Sister Jones, wife of A. T. Jones. We found her with her children usually well. We called on Sister Haskell. Tried to comfort her. Sister Harris and I had a season of prayer with her and we were all blessed.--Ms. 42, 1890, p. 3 (Diary 16, pp. 220-221).
